annotations.description: PS cell colonies before dissociation and upon replating for induction (Stage 1).
100% confluent layer of PS cells, 1 d post-replating at the beginning of neural induction (Stage 2).
Multilayer of neuroepithelial cells after 9 d in neural induction medium, ready for replating for NR formation (Stage 2).

SNR with clearly visible lumen and size >200 μm in diameter ready for isolation, after 9 d in neural induction medium, 4 d in amplification medium with EGF/FGF2, 10 d in amplification medium with EGF only and 1 d post-replating.
SNR after manual isolation ready for propagation in a 96-well plate (Stage 4).
Organoids failed to grow beyond 1–1.5 mm in diameter in 96-well plates even after extended propagation in FGF2- and EGF-containing medium.
SNR-derived organoids were embedded into Matrigel (MG) droplets following the approach by Lancaster and Knoblich.
After MG embedding, organoids showed substantial tissue growth, cell migration into MG, and extensive radiation of fibers.
Organoids continued expanding in MG for 4 months, reaching 3–5 mm in diameter by ~5 months post-induction (~4 months post-embedding).
Between 3 and 4 months post-embedding, organoids were treated with BDNF, NT3, and GDNF to promote neuronal survival, maturation, and synapse development.
Trophic factors were applied later in differentiation to promote synaptic development and minimize premature or ectopic neuronal differentiation.
Images of SNR-derived organoids at 3 d post-isolation (a), 7 d post-isolation (b), and 14 d post-isolation (c). Scale bar, 250 μm.
